explanation: formal; to become less strong; to make something less strong
sentence: The storm showed no signs of abating.
sentence_gap: The storm showed no signs of _______.

explanation: formal; to increase in number or amount over a period of time
sentence: Interest will accrue on the account at a rate of seven percent.
sentence_gap: Interest will ______ on the account at a rate of seven percent.

explanation: an idea, thought, or plan that was not originally intended but is thought of at a later time
sentence: The pillars seem to have been added to the entrance as an afterthought.
sentence_gap: The pillars seem to have been added to the entrance as an ____________.

explanation: formal; said or thought by some people to be the stated bad or illegal thing, although you have no proof
sentence: Several alleged drug lords are to be put on trial.
sentence_gap: Several _______ drug lords are to be put on trial.

explanation: a formal agreement during a war to stop fighting and discuss making peace
sentence: The armistice was signed on December 4.
sentence_gap: The _________ was signed on December 4.

explanation: that you can trust and respect as true and correct
sentence: The book is an authoritative account of the Second World War.
sentence_gap: The book is an _____________ account of the Second World War.

sentence: We saw a fairly large black creature with a streak of white - a badger.
sentence_gap: We saw a fairly large black creature with a streak of white - a ______.

explanation: a large boat with a flat bottom, used for carrying goods and people on canals and rivers
sentence: Their canals are excellently constructed, and they can carry heavy barges.
sentence_gap: Their canals are excellently constructed, and they can carry heavy ______.

sentence: Farmers in the area grow a wide range of crops but major crops include wheat, barley, and horse beans.
sentence_gap: Farmers in the area grow a wide range of crops but major crops include wheat, ______, and horse beans.

explanation: to enjoy sitting or lying in the heat or light of something, especially the sun
sentence: We could see seals on the rocks, basking in the sun.
sentence_gap: We could see seals on the rocks, _______ in the sun.

explanation: informal, old-fashioned; unkind or unpleasant
sentence: Don't be so beastly to him!
sentence_gap: Don't be so _______ to him!

explanation: literary; to see or look at someone or something
sentence: The new bridge is an incredible sight to behold.
sentence_gap: The new bridge is an incredible sight to ______.

sentence: He sat in his short overcoat leaning against a birch tree.
sentence_gap: He sat in his short overcoat leaning against a _____ tree.

explanation: a large cave
sentence: The underground cavern was formed where water used to flow.
sentence_gap: The underground ______ was formed where water used to flow.

explanation: a young male horse up to the age of four or five

sentence_gap: Dandy was the first ____ born on their ranch.

explanation: the fact that people who have a disease or condition also have one or more other diseases or conditions
sentence: The study suggests that there may be greater comorbidity between the two conditions than has been acknowledged.

explanation: formal; to agree or have the same opinion
sentence: The new report concurs with previous findings.
sentence_gap: The new report _______ with previous findings.

explanation: formal; a belief or an opinion that you express, especially in an argument; angry disagreement between people
sentence: It is our client's contention that the fire was an accident.
sentence_gap: It is our client's __________ that the fire was an accident.

explanation: next to or touching another, usually similar, thing
sentence: The countries are contiguous.
sentence_gap: The countries are __________.

explanation: someone who can twist their body into shapes and positions that normal people cannot
sentence: Below, a contortionist on a pedestal folded up her costumed body, insect-like and alien.
sentence_gap: Below, a _____________ on a pedestal folded up her costumed body, insect-like and alien.

explanation: a promise to someone, or a legal agreement, especially one to pay a regular amount of money to someone or something
sentence: The contract contained a restrictive covenant against building on the land.
sentence_gap: The contract contained a restrictive ________ against building on the land.

explanation: formal; willingness to believe that something is real or true, especially when this is unlikely
sentence: The plot of the novel stretches credulity to the limit.
sentence_gap: The plot of the novel stretches _________ to the limit.

explanation: disappointed and sad because of having failed unexpectedly
sentence: The crestfallen butcher returned to his shop, and the news spread that he was a fraudulent trader.
sentence_gap: The ___________ butcher returned to his shop, and the news spread that he was a fraudulent trader.

explanation: a person in a university who is in charge of a department of studies

sentence_gap: Paweł Strzelecki is the ____ of the Faculty of Mathematics, Informatics and Mechanics at the University of Warsaw.

explanation: to pour liquid, especially wine, from one container into another
sentence: Decant the wine and allow it to stand at room temperature for a couple of hours.
sentence_gap: ______ the wine and allow it to stand at room temperature for a couple of hours.

explanation: in very bad condition because of being old, or not having been cared for, or having been used a lot

sentence_gap: A ________ old man sat on a park bench.

explanation: to change direction or make something change direction, especially after hitting something
sentence: The ball deflected off my shoulder, straight into the goal.

explanation: formal; harmful and damaging

sentence_gap: These drugs have a proven ___________ effect on the nervous system.

explanation: formal; the way that someone looks, seems, and behaves

sentence_gap: There was nothing in his ________ that suggested he was anxious.

explanation: to take something, especially something necessary or pleasant, away from someone
sentence: You can't function properly when you're deprived of sleep.
sentence_gap: You can't function properly when you're ________ of sleep.

explanation: the very small drops of water that form on the ground, etc. during the night

explanation: to bend, hang, or move downward, especially because of being weak or tired

sentence_gap: She was so tired, her eyelids were beginning to _____.

explanation: a state of extreme happiness or excitement

explanation: a word or an expression that is used to show affection
sentence: “Darling” is a term of endearment.
sentence_gap: “Darling” is a term of __________.

explanation: to say or pronounce words clearly; (formal) to express an idea clearly and exactly
sentence: She enunciated each word slowly and carefully. He enunciated his vision of the future.
sentence_gap: She __________ each word slowly and carefully. He __________ his vision of the future.

explanation: formal; not correct; based on wrong information

sentence_gap: He seems to be under the _________ impression that she is in love with him.

explanation: formal or old-fashioned; deserving respect and admiration
sentence: I would never doubt the worthy intentions of that estimable gentleman.
sentence_gap: I would never doubt the worthy intentions of that _________ gentleman.

explanation: not directly connected with the particular situation you are in or the subject you are dealing with
sentence: We do not want any extraneous information on the page.
sentence_gap: We do not want any __________ information on the page.

explanation: to have a lot of a particular quality or feeling; to produce a smell or liquid substance from inside
sentence: She just exudes confidence. Some trees exude a sap that repels insect parasites.
sentence_gap: She just _____s confidence. Some trees _____ a sap that repels insect parasites.

explanation: any of the physical or mental abilities that a person is born with
sentence: She retained her mental faculties until the day she died.

explanation: (disapproving) to show something you are proud of to other people, in order to impress them
sentence: He's got a lot of money but he doesn't flaunt it.
sentence_gap: He's got a lot of money but he doesn't ______ it.

explanation: formal; a piece of clothing
sentence: It was observed that she was tearful when she was asked to take off her lower garments.
sentence_gap: It was observed that she was tearful when she was asked to take off her lower ________.

explanation: (disapproving) with no particular order or plan; not organized well

sentence_gap: The whole examination process seemed completely _________.

explanation: formal; unlucky and usually unhappy
sentence: Many children are hapless victims of this war.

explanation: the hard part of the foot of some animals, for example horses

explanation: (formal) to absorb something, especially information; (formal or humorous) to drink something, especially alcohol

explanation: not wanting or not able to believe something, and usually showing this

explanation: formal; always determined and energetic in trying to achieve something and never willing to admit defeat

explanation: feeling or showing anger and surprise because you think that you have been treated unfairly
sentence: She was very indignant at the way she had been treated.

explanation: (approving) working hard; busy
sentence: She's extremely competent and industrious.

explanation: formal; a guess that you make or an opinion that you form based on the information that you have
sentence: They were warned to expect a heavy air attack and by inference many casualties.

explanation: (of animals and insects that carry disease) to cause a problem by being present in large numbers
sentence: The barn was infested with rats.
sentence_gap: The barn was ________ with rats.

explanation: a slight knowledge of something that is happening or about to happen
sentence: The first inkling I had that something was wrong was when I found the front door wide open.
sentence_gap: The first _______ I had that something was wrong was when I found the front door wide open.

explanation: the round colored part that surrounds the pupil of your eye
sentence: When you say someone is blue-eyed, you are referring to the color of their irises.

explanation: to talk quickly and in an excited way so that it is difficult to understand what you are saying
sentence: What is he jabbering about now?
sentence_gap: What is he _________ about now?

explanation: a sudden rough movement; a sudden strong feeling, especially of shock or surprise

explanation: (figurative) a large and powerful force or institution that cannot be controlled

sentence_gap: Health care has turned into something of a __________ in the economy recently.

explanation: a round wooden or metal container with a flat top and bottom, used especially for storing beer, like a barrel but smaller

sentence_gap: A ___ is usually the easiest way to provide beer to a large group of people.

explanation: formal; (of actions and behavior) deserving praise, even if there is little or no success

explanation: a piece of thick material that you put on the floor, often in order to protect it

explanation: (of an animal) to attack and injure someone by tearing their flesh; to touch someone or something in an unpleasant and/or violent way

explanation: an action, an object, or a system by which a result is achieved; a way of achieving or doing something

sentence: The fog is expected to have cleared away by midday.

explanation: (formal) an action that is bad or unacceptable, but not very serious; (law) a crime that is not considered to be very serious

sentence_gap: Indeed, larcenies can be designated as a ___________ or felony, depending on the state.

explanation: (of a bird or animal) to lose feathers, skin, or hair as a natural process before a new growth of feathers, skin, or hair

sentence_gap: After three to four months, pups ____ to the color of adult females and subadults.

explanation: a covering put over an animal's nose and mouth in order to prevent it from biting

sentence_gap: She asked him to put a ______ on his dog after it scared her children.

explanation: literary; a small quiet place or corner that is sheltered or hidden from other people
sentence: The black dress she wore fit her like a second skin, outlining every curve, dip and nook of her body.
sentence_gap: The black dress she wore fit her like a second skin, outlining every curve, dip and ____ of her body.

explanation: not conscious of something, especially what is happening around you

sentence_gap: Absorbed in her work, she was totally _________ of her surroundings.

explanation: to flow slowly out of something through a small opening, or to slowly produce a thick sticky liquid

sentence_gap: Blood was still ______ out of the wound.

explanation: a sudden sharp feeling, especially of painful emotion

explanation: one of a pair of curved hand-like parts of an animal such as a crab

sentence_gap: Crabs normally catch food with their _______.

explanation: formal; a very large amount of something, especially a larger amount than you need, want, or can deal with

explanation: formal

sentence_gap: His actions during the crisis were truly ____________.

explanation: that does not seem natural; that cannot be explained by natural laws
sentence: Anger gave me preternatural strength, and I managed to force the door open.

explanation: thick, yellowish liquid that forms in and comes from an infected cut or injury in the body

explanation: morally right and good

explanation: the outer, often curved or circular, edge of something

explanation: (in Christianity) the state of being saved from the power of evil; a way of protecting someone from danger, disaster, loss, etc.

explanation: to laugh and talk about a person or idea in a way that shows that you think they are stupid or silly

explanation: (of a place) quiet and private; not used or disturbed by other people

explanation: (of bodies) to move easily and quickly across a surface while twisting or curving

explanation: only present in small amounts or numbers and often spread over a large area

explanation: a white substance that exists in large amounts in potatoes and particular grains such as rice

explanation: a light ringing sound

sentence_gap: The school mascot is a ______ and the school colors are red, white, and gray.
